qas.question: On what island was the Bonaparte ancestral home located?
What was the name of Napoleon's family home?
Napoleon was most likely named after what family relation?

context: Napoleon was born on 15 August 1769, to <a0_0>Carlo Maria di Buonaparte<a0_0/> and <a1_0>Maria Letizia Ramolino<a1_0/>, in his family's ancestral home <a3_0>Casa Buonaparte<a3_0/> in Ajaccio, the capital of the island of <a2_0>Corsica<a2_0/>. He was their fourth child and third son. This was a year after the island was transferred to France by the Republic of Genoa. He was christened Napoleone di Buonaparte, probably named after <a4_0>an uncle<a4_0/> (an older brother who did not survive infancy was the first of the sons to be called Napoleone). In his 20s, he adopted the more French-sounding Napoléon Bonaparte.[note 2]
